Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in rejecting the applicant's refugee claim due to lack of credible evidence and identity
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 106 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Inconsistent and implausible evidence including unsigned affidavit and missing school records
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Board’s decision upheld; application for judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to provide credible evidence or reasonable explanation for absence of documentation
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Doubts regarding identity and religious affiliation due to discrepancies in evidence
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Assessment of credibility based on documentation or reasonable explanations for its absence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Refugee status based on fear of persecution
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim rejected due to lack of credibility
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Unsigned affidavit, missing school records, lack of verifiable employment history
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities with heightened scrutiny on credibility
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Leave and certification for judicial review
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under federal court rules
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board / Federal Court
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of credible identity and supporting documentation
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Refugee determination and judicial review process

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to provide accurate personal information
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Credibility and documentation sufficiency in refugee claim
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in rejecting the claim due to lack of credible identity and religious affiliation documentation
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 106 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant’s documents and explanations implausible
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Conflicting documents: unsigned affidavit, flawed employment card
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution based on religion
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonable justification for lack of documentation
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Implausibility of explanations and inconsistencies in submitted documents
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to produce acceptable identification or plausible explanation
Crimes.Review_Outcome: No patently unreasonable finding; dismissal confirmed
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Credible evidence or reasonable excuse for absence
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of error in credibility assessment
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Alleged but not proven; focus on omissions and implausibility
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant challenged reasonableness of Board’s findings
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide verifiable personal history documents
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Lack of credibility and failure to establish identity

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Authenticity of documents submitted in refugee claim
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in finding documents fraudulently obtained and discrediting the applicant’s identity and claim
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 106 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Anomalies in affidavit, ETC, and employment card; missing security features
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: Applicant failed to justify authenticity or provide alternative verification
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Testimonial inconsistencies and questionable document integrity
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Need for acceptable documentation or reasonable explanation for absence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Refugee protection based on fear of persecution
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to credibility and authenticity concerns
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Unsigned affidavit, employment card lacking security features, inconsistent testimony
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Contested Board’s conclusion on document authenticity
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities with emphasis on credibility
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Overturn of refusal and referral back for re-determination
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Submission of potentially fraudulent documents and false claims
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Refugee determination and subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Section 106 IRPA – Standards for assessing documentary credibility
